profile.profileDescription: Data model for the Husserl archive. Based on the SPECTRUM standard.

label.name: Other number
label.description: An alternate number and its type for an object other than the Identifier.

label.name: Other number
label.description: An alternate number for an object other than the Identifier and its type.

label.name: Type
label.description: Alternate number type.

label.name: Keywords/tags
label.description: Keywords for grouping objects on the same topic.

label.name: Description
label.description: Narrative description. This is the primary text used to document the item.

label.name: Comments
label.description: Additional comments made about an object by visitors, curators or researchers.

label.name: Object creation date
label.description: The date when a stage in the design, creation or manufacture of an object took place.

label.name: Object creation note
label.description: Additional information about an object's production.

label.name: Content - activity
label.description: An activity depicted in or described by an object.

label.name: Content - concept/subject
label.description: A concept depicted in or described by an object.

label.name: Content - language
label.description: The specific kind of object / work being described.

label.name: Content - concept/subject (LCSH)
label.description: A concept depicted in or described by an object. Look-up field using Library of Congress Subject Headings (LOD resource). To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Content - date
label.description: A date depicted in or described by an object.

label.name: Transcription date
label.description: The date a transcription was made

label.name: Transcription location
label.description: The location a transcription was made.

label.name: Content - Period
label.description: A period depicted in or described by an object.

label.name: Content - description
label.description: A general description of a depiction in an object, or description of an object without making interpretation. This may include descriptions of the content of all audio and visual works. (Use Description and Physical description to describe an object's other features.)

label.name: Content event
label.description: An event depicted in or described by an object. This field should only be used for unspecific events (e.g. Christmas). Use Content - event (relation) for historic events (e.g. Christmas 25/01/2017).

label.name: Content - event name
label.description: An event depicted in or described by an object. E.g. The Goose Fair; The Charge of the Light Brigade.

label.name: Content - event name
label.description: An event depicted in or described by an object. E.g. The Goose Fair; The Charge of the Light Brigade.

label.name: Content - event type
label.description: A term describing the nature of the Content - event name. Use a single term, without punctuation or capitalisation. Maintain a list of standard terms. E.g. coronation; massacre; battle; garden party

label.name: Dimensions
label.description: Physical dimensions of object

label.name: Dimensions
label.description: Physical dimensions of object"

label.name: Width
label.description: Width of object ; enter with units (eg. 10 cm)

label.name: Height
label.description: Height of object; enter with preferred units (eg. 10 cm)

label.name: Depth
label.description: Depth of object; enter with units (eg. 10 cm)

label.name: Dimensions
label.description: Physical dimensions of object

label.name: Material
label.description: The basic materials and media from which an object is constructed.

label.name: Right type
label.description: The specific type of right being recorded in relation to an object, document, photograph, work of art or record.

label.name: GeoNames
label.description: A Geographic lookup that takes search text, passes it to the GeoNames search service and provides a dropdown with search results (ordered by score). Selected geonames is stored as both text (name, country, continent and ID) and the service URL identifier.

label.name: Notes (internal)
label.description: Notes regarding item. Not for publication.

label.name: Biographical note
label.description: Information about the personal history of a Person.

label.name: Vital dates
label.description: Enter the birth and death dates for an entity.

label.name: Gender
label.description: The sex of a Person.

label.name: Nationality
label.description: A Person's official current nationality.

label.name: Occupation
label.description: The occupation or employment of a Person.

label.name: Date text
label.description: The textual expression of the date or date span when an event in an object's history is thought to have occurred.

label.name: Date(s) of lecture(s)
label.description: The probable or exact date at which the event is thought to have occurred. Can be a date range (e.g. 'circa 1950 - 1951' or '10-11-1950 - 30-05-1951')

label.name: Publication date
label.description: The probable or exact date at which the publication event is thought to have occurred.

label.name: Event date
label.description: The probable or exact date at which the event is thought to have occurred.

label.name: Location type
label.description: The nature or category of a Location. (e.g. display; storage; external)

label.name: Material / technique (AAT)
label.description: Look up materials/techniques in the Getty Arts and Architecture Thesaurus (LOD resource).

label.name: Object name (AAT)
label.description: Look up object names in the Getty Arts and Architecture Thesaurus (LOD resource).

label.name: Union List of Artist Names (ULAN)
label.description: Getty Union List of Artist Names thesaurus (LOD resource).

label.name: Virtual International Authority File (VIAF)
label.description: Virtual International Authority File (VIAF) (LOD resource).

label.name: Thesaurus of Geographic Names
label.description: Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names (LOD resource).

label.name: Wikipedia articles
label.description: Wikipedia articles.

label.name: Other documents and files
label.description: For additional documentation and files.

label.name: Record right type
label.description: The specific type of right being recorded in relation to the record (metadata).

label.name: Record license
label.description: The license stating the terms of reuse of the record (metadata) by external people/organisations.

label.name: License
label.description: The license stating the terms of reuse of the image, sound, video... by external people/organisations.

label.name: Object right
label.description: The specific type of right being recorded in relation to the original object being described.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Georeferencing allows you to associate a geographic location with your record.

label.name: Physical description
label.description: General visual appearance of an object.

label.name: Place of creation
label.description: A Place where the design, creation or manufacture of an object took place.

label.name: Content - Mentioned place
label.description: A Place depicted in or described by an object.

label.name: Content - Depicted place
label.description: A Place depicted in or described by an object.

label.name: Place of publication
label.description: Place of publication.

label.name: Location of lecture
label.description: Location of lecture.

label.name: Location of event
label.description: Location of event.

label.name: Place of birth
label.description: Place of Birth.

label.name: Place of death
label.description: Place of death.

label.name: Scope reference
label.description: Reference to description in Scope archive.

label.name: Style of writing
label.description: E.g. Gabelsberger shorthand

label.name: Type
label.description: E.g. Gabelsberger shorthand

label.name: Notes
label.description: Additional notes

settings.setting: A unique number identifying an object, including any separated parts.
The name assigned to an object or group of objects by the artist/creator or collector at the time of origin or subsequent titles either specifically assigned or generally understood to refer to it.
Other names assigned to an object or group of objects.
For adding manuscript collections related to the archival folder.
The Person involved in the design, creation or manufacture of an object. This may include the commissioner of an object.
An historic event depicted in or described by an object.
A person depicted in or described by an object.
The organisation depicted in or described in an object.
A people depicted in or described by an object.

Permanent storage location of the object.
